Title: Senior IBP Business System Analyst
Company: CÔNG TY TNHH QORVO VIỆT NAM
Location: 5th Floor, CIC Tower building, No. 2 Nguyen Thi Due Street, Cau Giay District, Hanoi, 5th Floor, CIC Tower - 219 Trung Kinh Street, Cau Giay District, Hanoi
Job Description:
Qorvo (Nasdaq: QRVO) supplies innovative semiconductor solutions that make a better world possible. We combine product and technology leadership, systems-level expertise and global manufacturing scale to quickly solve our customers' most complex technical challenges. Qorvo serves multiple high-growth segments of large global markets, including consumer electronics, smart home/IoT, automotive, EVs, battery-powered appliances, network infrastructure, healthcare and aerospace/defense. Visit www.qorvo.com to learn how our innovative team is helping connect, protect and power our planet.

The Sr. SAP IBP Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for the design, implementation, configuration, and ongoing support of SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) solutions.

This role requires the following: a deep understanding of supply chain planning principles, strong analytical skills, and expertise in leveraging SAP IBP modules to drive business value. The ideal candidate will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external partners to ensure seamless integration and optimal utilization of our IBP landscape.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead/participate in the end-to-end implementation of SAP IBP modules, including but not limited to:
• SAP IBP for Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP): Facilitate the S&OP process, including Consensus demand Process, Constrained and Unconstrained Supply Process
• SAP IBP for Demand: Design and configure demand planning processes, including statistical forecasting, demand sensing, and consensus demand planning.
• SAP IBP for Response & Supply: Implement supply planning, response management, and rough-cut capacity planning functionalities to optimize production and distribution.
• Conduct in-depth business process analysis and gather requirements from various supply chain functions (e.g., demand planning, supply planning)
• Translate business requirements into technical solutions within SAP IBP, including model configuration, planning area design, key figure definitions, attribute setup, and planning operator development.
• Perform data integration activities between SAP IBP and other systems (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP BW, non-SAP systems) using SAP Cloud Platform Integration – Data Services (CPI-DS) or other relevant tools.
• Develop and execute comprehensive test plans (unit, integration, user acceptance testing) to ensure the functionality and performance of configured solutions.
• Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and issue resolution for SAP IBP applications.
• Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including solution designs, configuration guides, test scripts, and user manuals.
• Train end-users and provide guidance on SAP IBP best practices and functionalities.
• Stay current with SAP IBP latest features, releases, and industry trends, assessing their impact and recommending adoption strategies.
• Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, project managers, and external consultants.
• Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the SAP IBP solution.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field with 8+ years of hands on experience in SAP IBP modules
• Deep functional and technical knowledge of multiple SAP IBP modules (e.g., S&OP, Demand, Response & Supply)
• Strong understanding of core supply chain planning processes (Demand forecasting, Supply planning, S&OP).
• Experience with data integration tools, specifically SAP CPI-DS.
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills (written and verbal).
• Ability to work independently
• Strong stakeholder management
• SAP IBP certification(s) is a plus.
• Experience with Agile methodology is a plus
• Experience with other SAP Modules (SAP- PP, MM, BW, SD) is a plus
• Candidates must be comfortable & willing to work in US time zone
• Proficient in English is a must as candidate will be working with global stakeholders
Keyword: CÔNG TY TNHH QORVO VIỆT NAM

Tốt nghiệp đại học chuyên ngành Tài chính, Kiểm toán, Kế toán các trường Học viện tài chính, Kinh tế quốc dân, Đại học ngoại thương, Đại học thương mại.

• Hiểu về luật doanh nghiệp, thuế, luật lao động, luật kế toán. Đặc biệt, hiểu sâu về nghiệp vụ kế toán, kiểm toán.

• Có khả năng Quản lý, dẫn dắt và tạo động lực làm việc cho đội nhóm.

Title: Communications Executive
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Anne Hill
Location: 31 Giang Van Minh street, An Phu ward, Thu Duc city, Ho Chi Minh city, số 31 đường Giang Văn Minh, Phường An Phú, Thành phố Thủ Đức, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam
Job Description:
Summary of Position:
Reporting to the Communications Coordinator, the Communications Executive is a junior-level position primarily responsible for supporting the SCP Department in ensuring clear, consistency, and engaging messaging across all school communications.
The main areas of focus include content development, social media management, website management, cross-department coordination, brand alignment, digital tool support, data analysis, and cross-functional collaboration – ensuring all communication efforts reflect the school’s core values and maintain consistency across channels

Key Relationships:
Internal:
• Communications Coordinator
• Head of Strategy, Communications & Policy (SCP)
• Marketing Department
• Head of School
• Heads of Department / Academic Team
• Admissions & Enrolment Team
External:
• Parents and guardians
• Media contacts and press (as needed)
• Partner organisations and vendors (e.g., designers, printers, survey platforms)
• Broader school community and alumni (via social and web content)

Key Responsibilities:
1. Communications Policy & Brand Compliance
• Implement school-wide written communication strategies in line with the School Communications Policy, as directed by the Head of SCP and coordinated by the Communications Coordinator.
• Ensure all communications maintain consistent tone, language, and visual identity, adhering to the school's Brand Guidelines and core values.
2. Internal & External Communications Coordination
• Liaise with the Management Team and departments to deliver timely, accurate communication to parents and stakeholders, following the Communications Request Procedures. This includes, but is not limited to, official updates, reminders, event invitations, and resource sharing.
• Collaborate with the Head of School Office and various departments to curate and design monthly newsletters across relevant platforms, ensuring optimal readability and user engagement.
• Prepare and distribute digital forms and surveys as needed. Monitor responses and support departments in interpreting survey results for data-informed decision-making.
• Assist in drafting external-facing content, including partner communications, press releases, and crisis messages, under the guidance of the Communications Coordinator and Head of SCP.
• Ensure all communications reflect the school’s guiding statements, CIS standards, unique selling points, and community spirit.
3. Publications & Content Development
Assist in developing and maintaining school publications such as Parent Handbooks, the School Prospectus, Yearbook, Fee Schedules, Admissions Materials, presentations, taglines, messaging pillars, and slogans. Ensure all written materials are accurate, aligned with school branding, and effectively communicate key messages to their intended audiences.
4. Social Media & Website Content Management
(in collaboration with the Copywriting Intern – who serves as the primary content executor)
Provide direction and oversight to the Copywriting Intern to ensure alignment with the school’s communication objectives, brand voice, and overall positioning:
• Support the development of long-term and weekly content calendars for the school’s social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn) and website.
• Review and oversee the drafting and publishing of engaging posts and articles that reflect school life and support Marketing and Enrolment goals.
• Ensure consistency and alignment across all digital platforms with the school’s mission, tone of voice, and strategic communication standards.
5. Communications Records & Resource Management
• Maintain an organised departmental resource folder on OneDrive/SharePoint, ensuring proper documentation and easy access to all communication records.
• Manage and update the Communications Calendar (Excel-based) using the approved template to track past, ongoing, and upcoming communications for transparency and departmental continuity.
6. Digital Tools, Data Management & Analysis
• Ensure professional design and accurate recipient segmentation when using the school’s emailing tool to send newsletters and email blasts.
• Regularly update recipient data by integrating information from the school’s data management system to ensure clean, reliable contact lists.
• Utilise existing tools – and suggest new ones where appropriate, to enhance communication efforts.
• Collect and analyse relevant metrics to evaluate communication effectiveness and support data-driven improvements.
7. Departmental & Cross-functional Support
• Assist the Communications Coordinator and Head of SCP in various strategic tasks including CIS accreditation, internal policies, departmental budgeting and payment documentation according to the approved budget and accounting procedures.
• Provide hands-on support at school events coordinated by the Marketing team to gain insight and create relevant post-event content.
• Collaborate effectively with the Marketing team in graphic design, publication development, and digital platform management to ensure cohesive messaging across all channels.
• Assist Marketing with all content-related tasks within their current scope, including drafting video scripts, marketing material content, and other communications support as needed.
8. Additional Responsibilities
Carry out any other duties assigned by the Communications Coordinator in support of the school’s strategic communication goals.
Job Requirements:
Experience / Knowledge:
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Education, Linguistics, or a related field
• 1-3 years’ experience in communications, marketing, or content-related role
• Experience in an international or educational environment
• Knowledge of school branding and/or CIS standards

Skills:
• Excellent spoken and written English and Vietnamese
• (proof of English language proficiency may be required)
• Excellent content editing skills
• Strong organisational and time management abilities
• Comfortable using Office tools and willing to learn new platforms
• Basic understanding of design (e.g. Canva, Illustrator) and data interpretation

Personal Attributes:
• Reliable, detail-oriented, and well-organised
• Adaptable and calm under pressure, with a flexible mindset and openness to change
• Collaborative, proactive, and self-motivated team player
• Open-minded and globally aware, with a genuine respect for diversity and equity
• Curious and reflective, with a willingness to learn and grow professionally
Keyword: Công Ty Cổ Phần Anne Hill

Title: Accounting Manager
Location: Ho Chi Minh Office (Headquarter), Floor 7, Habour View Building, 35 Nguyen Hue Street, Dist 1, HCM City
Job Description:
• Supervision of the Accounting function (General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Treasury)
• Management responsibility for four direct reports, including leave management, performance appraisal and individual development plans.
• Ensure financial records are maintained in compliance with company policies and procedures, and in accordance with HGB (German GAAP) and VAS (local GAAP).
• Coordinate monthly financial closing process to completion of financial statements.
• Review balance sheet reconciliations monthly. Identify and coordinate follow up action required.
• Oversee the maintenance of the Fixed Asset Register. Ensure capital costs and maintenance expenses are correctly recognized, and that depreciation methods and rates comply with HGB (German GAAP) and VAS (local GAAP).
• Provide SAP expertise for problem solving in General Ledger and sub-ledger functions.
• Identify and coordinate internal control processes for the accounting function.
• Monitor cash flow and working capital position. Coordinate cash flow forecasting, including identification of foreign currency requirements.
• Manage and coordinate the annual external audit process. Ensure Group and statutory requirements are met.

Title: Production Team Leader - Rubber
Company: Công Ty TNHH Trelleborg Việt Nam
Location: Phu My 3 Specialized Industrial Park, Ba Ria & Vung Tau Province, Vietnam, Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, Biên Hòa, Đồng Nai, Việt Nam, Lot 2, Street No 2, Phu My III Specialized Industrial Zone, Phuoc Hoa, Phu My, Ba Ria- Vung Tau
Job Description:
Do you want to experience new challenges and innovate the future of engineered polymer solutions? Accelerate your career with Trelleborg and start shaping industry from the inside.

WHO ARE WE?
Trelleborg Industrial Solutions (TIS) is a global leader in innovative polymer-based solutions for key industries and critical infrastructure. We are one of two Business Areas within the Trelleborg Group, with a total of about 6 200 employees around the world.

About Trelleborg Marine & Infrastructure business unit - with our comprehensive portfolio of smart engineered solutions designed for berthing, docking, and mooring, navigation and piloting, built and offshore infrastructure, we work to meet some of the core challenges centered around safety, efficiency, and sustainability. Join us and be part of a world-class team that is dedicated to excellence and innovation.

ABOUT THE JOB

I. General information:
- Job Title: Production Team Leader (Rubber manufacturing)
- Report to: Senior Process Engineer
- Working Location: Phu My 3 Specialized Industrial Park, Ba Ria & Vung Tau Province, Vietnam (Shuttle bus will be provided from 3 locations: Ho Chi Minh City, Bien Hoa City, and Vung Tau City)

II. Summary of the Role:
- Production know how: systematically focus on the Manufacturing process and Operator training.
- Techical support: coordinate with the Mechanical engineer, actively taking responsibility of Technical specification & support with Raw material / Process exception / Final Inspection / Independent problem solving / Technical transfer project, etc;
- Continous improvement: improvement with Safety /Quality / Efficiency / Capacity ramping up / Cost down / value stream / Lean manufacturing from the process side

III. Tasks & Responsibilities
- Assist in understanding product requirements, including product structure, related equipment, materials, and risk assessment.
- Support documenting current production procedures and help in maintaining Company standards to improve the efficiency of the Production Department.
- Monitor and verify workers' adherence to SOPs and support process training efforts.
- Conduct daily checks for process stability and product quality and report any issues to the Senior Process Engineer.
- Assist in solving minor quality problems in the production process and final inspection; escalate major issues to the Senior Process Engineer.
- Collaborate with the Quality Department to implement ongoing quality improvements under the guidance of the Senior Process Engineer.
- Stay updated on current production best practices and assist in implementing them under supervision.
- Help develop and implement production processes for new products, product enhancements, and product changes as guided by senior staff.
- Collect and summarize basic production and process data for reporting to the Senior Process Engineer and management.
- Assist in developing daily and weekly production schedules and follow up on task completion.
- Support the Senior Process Engineer in team training and development.
- Help maintain discipline and build good team spirit within the department.
- Provide feedback to other departments (e.g., Quality, Engineering) if any issues arise.
- Ensure accurate data entry into the ERP system.
- Attend meetings as required and follow up on actions assigned.
- Prepare basic weekly and monthly reports for submission to the Senior Process Engineer.
- Other ad-hoc tasks assigned by the Senior Process Engineer or Rubber MFG Manager.
Job Requirements:
ABOUT THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
- Bachelor's degree in major of rubber / polymer engineering.
- 3 years or more experience with good background in Rubber industrial manufacturing.
- Experienced in Compound Mixing and operating with Calender/Extruder.
- Experienced in people/operator management.
- Basic English.

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING WITH US?
1. Generous Paid Time Off: Enjoy 16 days of annual leave to relax, recharge, and pursue your passions outside of work.
2. Comprehensive Health Coverage: Stay healthy and worry-free with Private Health Insurance from PTI.
4. Security from Day One: We fully cover your Social Insurance contributions, even during your probation period, ensuring peace of mind right from the start.
5. Competitive Rewards: Benefit from a 13th-month salary.
6. Convenient Commute Options: Forget the hassle of commuting! We provide a comfortable Shuttle Bus service from Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa, and Vung Tau straight to our factory.
7. Additional Perks & Allowances: Enjoy added support with allowances for lunch, phone, and petrol, making your work-life smoother and more comfortable.
8. Accelerated Learning and Growth: As a newly established company, we have a lot of exciting projects ahead! This means you'll have numerous opportunities to learn, grow, and make a real impact right from the start.

Title: Senior Partner Coordinator
Location: Phòng 1141, tầng 11, Deutsches Haus, số 33, đường Lê Duẩn, phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1, TP Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, Level 13, UTS Building 10 (CB10) PO Box 123 Broadway NSW 2007 Australia
Job Description:
UTS College provides a pathway for students into the University of Technology, Sydney (UTS), one of Australia's leading universities, and it is our vision to actualise potential and enhance lives through the power of learning, our actions and our people. Our purpose is to provide the best available opportunity for students to develop the knowledge, skills & attributes they need to attain their goals through market leading courses, teaching excellence and an emphasis on the student experience.

We currently have the opportunity for a Senior Partner Coordinator to join our Partnerships and growth team. The purpose of this role is to support UTS College’s business targets by recruiting quality students in allocated regions within Vietnam. This involves supporting the Partner Managers on key events with education agents, key High Schools and other relevant stakeholders.

This is a full time ongoing position based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.

The purpose of this role is to support UTS College’s business targets by recruiting quality students in allocated regions within Vietnam. This involves supporting the Partner Managers on key events with education agents, key High Schools and other relevant stakeholders.

This position is responsible for:
• Participate in student recruitment events and activities in designated market as well as other regions as required
• Support the lead generation and conversion process
• Support the Partner Manager to attend channel partner exhibitions, seminars, social media and other initiatives.
• Assist their new and existing students as required by working with education agents and internal relevant stakeholders
• Support & grow new/potential education agent by training, answering student related queries and ensuring provision of consistent and superior levels of customer service.
• Support social media activities in Vietnam, translations and other digital/marketing campaign support for Vietnam. Working closely with CAD team.
• Support Partner Manager with High Schools Engagement activities, other external stakeholders
• General administration, handling all travel-related documentation, business expenses and reporting
• Comply with all UTS College policies and procedures and maintain agreed quality and education standards
• Support Partner Manager to compile regular reports and others as required.
Job Requirements:
About you
To succeed in this role you must have:
• A Bachelor Degree in a relevant discipline.
• Minimum of 3 years experience in consultancy or business support (experience in international education or marketing will be highly beneficial)
• High degree of skill in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint and other CRMs
• Fluent in English and Vietnamese (spoken and written)
• Clear and personable communicator with excellent written and presentation skills
• Outstanding organisational and time management skills
• Proactive, adaptable, and solution-focused — can manage tasks independently with minimal supervision
• Willingness to learn
• Cross-cultural respect and understanding
• High level of communication skills including excellent stakeholder management skills, both written and verbal
• High level of attention to detail and accuracy
• Demonstrates a high level of integrity, very well-developed

What UTS College has to offer
• A flexible work environment
• A diverse workplace with a passion for encouraging and supporting inclusiveness
• Wellbeing programs (including free and confidential access to an Employee Assistance Program, and wellbeing initiatives and resources)
• Continuous learning and professional development (including ongoing learning & development opportunities, free LinkedIn Learning access and the UTS Library)
• Career progression and gateway to the Education sector
• An easy-to-use Staff Recognition Program
• A collaborative culture built on our Ethics of Respect, Integrity, Courage, Imagination, Compassion and Honesty

Title: Senior Key Account Executive (Forwarding and Logistics Industry)

Job Description:
The Senior Key Account Executive will manage strategic client relationships within the logistics and supply chain sector, ensuring exceptional service delivery, revenue growth, and long-term partnerships. This role requires a deep understanding of logistics operations, freight solutions (air, ocean, land), and supply chain challenges.

1. Client Management
o Act as the main liaison for key clients (e.g., manufacturers, retailers), addressing logistics needs (freight forwarding, warehousing, customs clearance).
o Proactively resolve operational issues (delays, documentation, compliance) with internal teams (operations, customs, carriers).
2. Business Growth
o Expand account revenue through cross-selling (e.g., value-added services like warehousing, last-mile delivery, insurance).
o Negotiate contracts and pricing with clients and logistics partners.
3. Logistics Expertise
o Advise clients on optimizing supply chain efficiency, cost savings, and risk mitigation.
o Stay updated on industry trends (e.g., digital freight platforms, sustainability initiatives).
4. Travel Requirements
o Domestic/International Travel: Up to 30% for client meetings, site visits (warehouses/ports), and industry events.
o On-Site Support: Occasional visits to key hubs or ports to oversee operations or resolve critical issues.
Job Requirements:
1. Experience: 5+ years in key account management within logistics, freight forwarding, or supply chain.
2. Skills:
a. In-depth knowledge of logistics processes (incoterms, customs regulations, freight documentation).
b. Proficiency in logistics software (WMS / TMS) and CRM tools.
c. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, operational environment.
3. Education: Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or Business.

This role is an exciting opportunity to join a leading fresh produce company and oversee our QC process for our products in Vietnam.

Title: Assistant Merchandiser
Company: Siplec - South East Asia Sourcing office
Location: 7th Floor Agrex Building 58 Vo Van Tan, District 3 Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 7th Floor Agrex Building 58 Vo Van Tan, District 3 Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
The South East Asia Sourcing Office of a leading European Supermarket Chain is looking for an Assistant Merchandiser for a period of 5 to 6 months : August 2025 to Jan 2026. Possibility of full time job at the end of the period.


YOUR MAIN MISSIONS :

FOLLOW-UP OF ORDERS : FROM SIGNATURE TO SHIPMENT

- At all time, under the supervision of your Senior Merchandiser, you will be the link between South East Asian Factories and European buyers.
- By using the internal IT systems you will follow the sequence of all approvals (product conformity, delivery date, packaging details…) before the start of production.
- You will follow the production schedule of factories and ensure that everything is done to secure on-time deliveries.
- You will ensure that required Quality Controls are performed before Shipment.
- You will supervise the Shipments with nominated agencies and secure shipment details and documents.

MANAGEMENT OF SAMPLES

- With the help of the Quality Team, you will request, receive and check required samples before sending them to final destination.
- You will make sure that samples remaining in office are properly labelled and stored.

COMMUNICATION

- You will maintain a regular communication, by various means, with all parties to make sure that orders are shipped at the right time, in the right quality.
- You will adapt the tone of your communication according to circumstances and counterparts.
- You will report regularly to your team leader, particularly when he or she is travelling.
- You will inform and alert your team leader and management whenever a situation represents a risk regarding the level of quality, or the date of delivery.
- You will participate in finding and proposing solutions and appropriate actions.
Job Requirements:
- You have recently graduated from University, preferably, but not only, in subjects related to International Business or Logistics.
- You can show some solid analytical skills and a logical mind.
- Your communication is straight to the point, efficient and reliable.
- You are used to express yourself in English, both written and spoken.
- You are dynamic, you have a strong learning ability and a good sense of priorities
- You can combine an excellent team spirit with a good ability to work independently

Seize this opportunity to work in a multinational environment, in a small structure, within a leading European Group of distribution.

Title: Financial Control & Operations Specialist
Location: Central: 17 Le Duan, Ben Nghe, District 1, HCMC, The Central Plaza, 17 Le Duan, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Job Description
The incumbent will be part of the Entity Reporting & Control team within UOB Vietnam Finance & Corporate Services, focusing on Financial operations & control.

Responsibilities
1. Financial Control:
• Daily review of reconciliation reports of all bank’s accounts including products, non-products, suspense, nostro and FX position accounts, identifying and resolving discrepancies.
• Follow up with relevant GL owners on the outages and unreconciled balances.
• Perform balance confirmation and aging monitor for required GL and work with relevant GL owners to clear within timeline.
• Prepare and ensure timely journal entries postings in SAP system as per accounting policies.
• Review and ensure the accuracy and completeness of General Ledger including but not limited to review of Trial balances and other relevant files to timely identify unusual postings, abnormal GL balances and/or abnormal cost center balances.
• Assist in month-end, and year-end financial closing procedures.
• Advise on creation, deletion and maintenance of SAP GL.
• Advise on accounting entries and relevant posting where required.
• Work with stakeholders in local and Head Office on projects and Head Office cost allocation.
• Act as coordinator and perform declaration of ERC outsourcing & non-outsourcing contracts.
• Support Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and Key Risk and Control Self-Assessment (KRCSA) processes.

2. Financial Operations:
• Receive and check payment requests and related supporting documents to ensure completion and compliance with internal and regulatory requirements before processing into SAP AP system.
• Work directly with Business Units and dealing with relevant stakeholders to obtain further clarifications and justifications required in daily work as well as provide consultancy and guidance for accounting treatments and payment processes.
• Park invoice/LIV/Downpayment in SAP based on Payment request nature.
• Prepare and park accrual and prepaid journal entries for operational expenditures.
• Process fixed asset creation and management and ensure asset classification in compliance with local regulations and internal policy.
• Monthly review downpayment tracking and follow up with stakeholders for clearing.
• Ensure vendor master data in order.
• Verify and post Head Office recharge on monthly basis.
• Prepare voucher filing and archiving.

3. Other responsibilities:
• Improvement/Enhancement for in-charged processes.
• Coordinate with internal & external auditors if required by providing necessary documentation.
• Participate in related accounting, finance, enhancement and automation projects.
• Other tasks assigned by Team Lead and Head of ERC.
Job Requirements:
Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.
• Experience in ERP systems (SAP or similar banking software).
• Hard-working, attention to details.
• Experience on shared services model is an advantage.
• Fluent in spoken and written English.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office.
• Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• At least 5 years of working in GL or AP function, preferably in banking or financial services.

Title: Quality Engineer
Location: Lot i8-1, Sai Gon High Tech Park, Thu Duc City, HCMC, Lot I8 - 1, Saigon Hi-Tech Park (SHTP), Dist 9, HCMC
Job Description:
The following are the primary duties and responsibilities. Additional tasks may be assigned as needed:

Develop and maintain QA plans and process routings that accurately reflect intended and actual activities.

Provide support for all quoting activities by participating in the design, development, and implementation of initial processes.

Evaluate and support inspection processes through the development of inspection aids and instructional guidelines.

Support training programs by developing and implementing specialized sessions tailored to relevant functions.

Periodically review and maintain all documentation files; establish effective systems for document storage and retrieval.

Review all supplier and customer discrepancies; coordinate and track corrective and preventive action efforts.

Analyze defect trends occurring at the customer, supplier, and internal levels.

Participate in vendor survey activities when applicable.

Encourage proactive engagement with suppliers and assist with their process improvement efforts when possible.

Interface with all departments concerning company policies and procedures, with special emphasis on ISO, EN4600, and GMP documentation.

Monitor departmental activities and provide both technical and logistical support to the quality engineering team, as applicable.

Serve as a technical liaison on quality issues with customers as required.

Lead corrective action efforts by utilizing SPC data and corrective action tracking systems; initiate meetings, procedures, or team-building activities as necessary.

Act as a liaison between Jabil Circuit and suppliers or customers on quality-related matters.

Enhance technical support within the quality organization.

Follow all safety and health regulations related to this position, as well as any directives provided by the supervisor.

Comply with all procedures outlined in the company's security policy.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree required and at least two years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Good command of English
• Background in Electronic/ Electrical field is preferrable

Title: Recruitment & Employer Branding Specialist
Location: 6, Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Đa Kao, Quận 1, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, LOCATION Road 11, Bien Hoa I Industrial Zone, Bien Hoa City, Dong Nai

Title: D2C Store Leader - Samsung West Lake Store Hanoi
Location: PVI Tower No. 1, Pham Van Bach, Yen Hoa Cau Giay Hà Nội Vietnam, 25th Floor, Bitexco Financial Tower, 02 Hai Trieu Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, HCMC, Vietnam
Job Description:
To supervise and manage all departments of the store in order to maximize customer satisfaction, sales, commercial opportunities and controlling costs to achieve business targets.

[Strategic Decision]
1. Develop strategic retail plan for the store. 
2. Set the direction and methods for improving store operation and monitor store KPIs to manage performance.
3. Managing monthly sales/traffic/NPS targets.

[Sales Management]
4. Actively drive sales by implementing sales building initiatives across the three departments through effective analysis of the company commercial reports and visual layout. 
5. Determine the strategy of the store, always striving to maximize sales opportunities. 

[Customer Service Management]
6. Ensure a high level of customer service standards are consistently attained in the store in the three departments.
7. Monitor customer satisfaction score weekly/monthly to have action if needed.
8. Ensure the store is compliant with all company initiatives. 
9. Lead by example to perpetuate the Samsung culture.

[Product Management]
10. Supervise managers for controlling and managing stock, product rotation, orders.
11. To be well informed about current industry trends and to constantly analyze the competitor’s product and market in order to be able to maximize sales.

[People Management]
12. Secure human resources for the store by making hiring decisions for job positions.
13. Monitoring and managing recruitment and HR-related tasks for the entire store.
14. Establish and manage monthly work schedules for the entire store.
15. Conduct & supervise daily stand-up meetings and staff training.
16. Conducting assessments for the development of employees' skills and performance mgt., and appropriately allocating rewards within the allocated budget for the store.
17. To work with HR in order to create and have actions plans to motivate & develop the team.

[Operation Management]
18. Oversee the business development team with function management.
19. Constantly monitor overall store operation status and resolve issues if rise.
20. Monitor online and offline public relations.
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor degree of marketing/ or business administration or equivalent. 
- At least 4 - 5 years’ experience Store Management for Well-known Brands in Retail/Fashion/Cosmetics...
- Strong knowledge and experience with Store Operation 
- Strong leadership and Collaborative, Creative, resourceful & strategic minded. 
- Independent, self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 
- Good analytical skills and high adaptability in a fast moving environment. 
- Excellent English Skills, Able to communicate in Korean is an advantage
- Willing to work by shift.

Title: Head of D2C Retail
Location: 2 Hải Triều, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, 25th Floor, Bitexco Financial Tower, 02 Hai Trieu Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, HCMC, Vietnam
Job Description:
Job Profile Summary

1. Set and implement in-store strategy in link to product and marketing strategies.

2. Increase the in-store purchase rate through differentiated in-store display and customer experience solutions.

3. Carry out in-store total solution consulting and improvement efforts for retail store conditions.

4. Enhances or Improves methods or procedures and provides coaching to team members to ensure successful outcome

Job Description
1. [in-store strategy planning] Drive the planning of the stores operation strategy in relation to the product and marketing strategies and oversee the in-store strategies based on regional retail strategy.

2. [Creating and distributing in-store display guideline] Create a guide for differentiated in-store display based on the store management strategy, and oversee to ensure that the guideline is localized in a timely and accurate manner.

3. [Customer experience solution development and expansion] Drive the development of experience solutions (function, design) that enhance customer satisfaction and expansion of the solutions.

4. [Supporting retail improvement] Manage in-store total solution consulting activities and common improvement efforts for the betterment of retail store conditions.
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor degree of marketing/ or business administration or equivalent.
- At least 8 years’ experience Store Management/Retail Management for Well-known Brands in Electronics/ Retail/Fashion/Cosmetics industry
- Strong knowledge and experience with Store Operation/Retail Management
- Strong leadership and Collaborative, Creative, resourceful & strategic minded.
- Independent, self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
- Good analytical skills and high adaptability in a fast moving environment.
- Excellent English Skills

Title: Lập Trình Viên .Net
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Chứng Khoán SSI
Location: 1C Ngô Quyền - Hoàn Kiếm - Hà Nội, 1C Ngô Quyền - Hoàn Kiếm - Hà Nội
Job Description:
• Phân tích, thiết kế và phát triển các hệ thống phần mềm phục vụ quản lý nguồn vốn, nghiệp vụ tài chính kế toán, tích hợp hệ thống ERP.
• Phát triển và tối ưu các dịch vụ backend sử dụng .NET Core (Web API, Worker Service...), phục vụ giao tiếp giữa các hệ thống nghiệp vụ và kế toán.
• Làm việc chặt chẽ với các chuyên viên phân tích nghiệp vụ (BA), kế toán viên để đảm bảo hiểu đúng và triển khai chuẩn quy trình kế toán, định khoản, báo cáo.
• Xây dựng các thành phần tích hợp với hệ thống bên ngoài: ngân hàng, hệ thống ERP nội bộ, phần mềm kế toán, kho dữ liệu...
• Thiết kế CSDL quan hệ, viết stored procedure, tối ưu hiệu năng truy vấn phục vụ xử lý dữ liệu tài chính lớn và phức tạp.
• Tham gia rà soát mã nguồn (code review), tối ưu kiến trúc kỹ thuật, đảm bảo hiệu suất và bảo mật hệ thống.
• Tham gia triển khai, vận hành, hỗ trợ khắc phục sự cố trong quá trình đưa hệ thống vào hoạt động thực tế.
Job Requirements:
Kiến thức & kinh nghiệm chuyên môn:
• Tốt nghiệp Đại học chuyên ngành CNTT, Khoa học máy tính hoặc các ngành liên quan.
• Tối thiểu 3–6 năm kinh nghiệm lập trình .NET, trong đó có ít nhất 2 năm sử dụng .NET Core/.NET 6+.
• Có kinh nghiệm làm việc với RESTful API, Web API, hiểu rõ các nguyên lý lập trình backend, bảo mật API, kiểm soát session/token.
• Thành thạo C#, Entity Framework Core, LINQ, SQL Server/PostgreSQL.
• Có kinh nghiệm làm việc trong dự án có tích hợp nghiệp vụ tài chính – kế toán, quy trình định khoản, luân chuyển dòng tiền là một lợi thế lớn.
• Hiểu rõ về mô hình kiến trúc tầng (layered architecture), repository pattern, clean architecture.
• Có kinh nghiệm thiết kế và triển khai hệ thống tích hợp (integration system), message queue (RabbitMQ/Kafka), hoặc microservices là điểm cộng.
• Có khả năng viết unit test, sử dụng xUnit/NUnit, và CI/CD là lợi thế.
Kỹ năng mềm & nền tảng:
• Tư duy logic, cẩn trọng, có khả năng xử lý các nghiệp vụ tài chính phức tạp.
• Chủ động trong công việc, có khả năng dẫn dắt kỹ thuật nhóm nhỏ.
• Có khả năng phân tích hệ thống, đề xuất giải pháp kỹ thuật phù hợp.
• Giao tiếp và phối hợp hiệu quả với BA, kiểm thử, và người dùng cuối.
• Khả năng đọc hiểu tài liệu kỹ thuật tiếng Anh tốt.
Keyword: Công Ty Cổ Phần Chứng Khoán SSI
